title: Practical Thermocouple Thermometry - Thomas W. Kerlin
description:
Practical Thermocouple Thermometry - Thomas W. Kerlin (ISA, 1999).pdf

This book is intended to provide a resource to help the user select, install and use thermocouples properly. Temperature is the most commonly measured quantity in industry and thermocouples are the most common device for making temperature measurements. Since there is a tremendous incentive to optimize the selection, installation and use of thermocouples, the author presents a general understanding about the principles of thermocouple thermometry. Contents: Introduction to Thermocouple Thermometry Fundamentals Measuring Temperature with a Thermocouple Configurations Insulators for Sheathed Thermocouples Thermomcouple Types Degradation Selecting Thermocouples
